page.title: 05Attitudes,Eyesores,Apathy
page.content: Although it is felt that the character of Cil-y-cwm, once the show village of the old county of Carmarthen has been eroded, few voices have been raised against undesirable developments. People feel strongly about unsightly buildings and certain other issues, but a sense of apathy prevails. They are of largely suspicious nature, yet holiday homes are tolerated and tourists and newcomers are generally accepted. There is more affluence and more tolerant attitude towards moral standards. An awareness of the need for conservation is apparent, even though there are different interpretations of what conservation really means.
